intro: Fimbristylis urvilleana, commonly known as the narrowleaf flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, Africa, and Australia. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes grass-like plants known as sedges. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. It has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Fimbristylis urvilleana is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support wetland biodiversity.
